title: Life in cold lands: Eskimo village
brief_description: Fishing, seal hunting, trapping animals for fur, putting up the tent which is their summer home, shopping in the village store - these are among the common activities in the life of the Agootuk family. Eskimos of Unalakleet, Alaska. Through this intimate study of the family at its daily tasks, pupils become aware of the patterns of living persons whose environment is a cold land.
